skills.name: Complete multi-step conversions of mass that use division
Change decimals of hours into minutes

explanations.A: 2 hours = 2 x 60 =120 minutes. 0.1 hours = 0.1 x 60 = 6 minutes. In total we have 126 minutes.
explanations.B: I think you have found the correct number of minutes in 2 hours, but then added on 1 minute rather than 0.1 of an hour. What is 0.1 of an hour in minutes?
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied by 100. Remember there are 60 minutes in an hour.
explanations.D: I think you have found the correct number of minutes in 2 hours, but then added on 10 minute rather than 0.1 of an hour. What is 0.1 of an hour in minutes? (remember 0.1 is a tenth)

explanations.A: I think you have found the correct number of minutes in 3 hours, but then added on 2 minutes rather than 0.2 of an hour. What is 0.2 of an hour in minutes?
explanations.B: I think you have found the correct number of minutes in 3 hours, but then added on 20 minutes rather than 0.2 of an hour. What is 0.2 of an hour in minutes? (remember 0.2 is 2 tenths)
explanations.C: 3 hours = 3 x 60 =180 minutes. 0.2 hours = 0.2 x 60 = 12 minutes. In total we have 192 minutes.
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied by 100. Remember there are 60 minutes in an hour.

explanations.A: I think you divided by 10. How many centimeters are in a metre?
explanations.B: Almost, but you have made a small error with your place value. Try writing the number in a place value chart and then move all the numbers the correct number of columns.
explanations.C: I think you have made a small error with your place value. Try writing the number in a place value chart and then move all the numbers the correct number of columns. Remember there are 100cm in a metre.
explanations.D: There are 100cm in a m so to go from cm to m we divide by 100. This give 3.02.

explanations.A: There are 100cm in a m so to go from cm to m we divide by 100. This give 6.07.
explanations.B: Almost, but you have made a small error with your place value. Try writing the number in a place value chart and then move all the numbers the correct number of columns.
explanations.C: I think you divided by 10. How many centimeters are in a metre?
explanations.D: I think you have made a small error with your place value. Try writing the number in a place value chart and then move all the numbers the correct number of columns. Remember there are 100cm in a metre.

explanations.A: I think you divided by 10. This would change mm to cm but we have square cm to square mm. Try working out the area of a 1cm by 1cm square and a 1mm by 1mm square to see what you need to multiply by.
explanations.B: I think you multiplied by 10. This would change cm to mm but we have square cm to square mm. Try working out the area of a 1cm by 1cm square and a 1mm by 1mm square to see what you need to multiply by.
explanations.C: To go from cm to mm we multiply by 10. To go from square cm to square mm we multiply by 10 squared. 5 x 10 squared = 5 x 100 = 500
explanations.D: I think you multiplied by 1000. Remember there are 10mm in a cm. Try working out the area of a 1cm by 1cm square and a 1mm by 1mm square to see what you need to multiply by.

explanations.A: I think you multiplied by 1000. Remember there are 10mm in a cm. Try working out the area of a 1cm by 1cm square and a 1mm by 1mm square to see what you need to multiply by.
explanations.B: I think you divided by 10. This would change mm to cm but we have square cm to square mm. Try working out the area of a 1cm by 1cm square and a 1mm by 1mm square to see what you need to multiply by.
explanations.C: I think you multiplied by 10. This would change cm to mm but we have square cm to square mm. Try working out the area of a 1cm by 1cm square and a 1mm by 1mm square to see what you need to multiply by.
explanations.D: To go from cm to mm we multiply by 10. To go from square cm to square mm we multiply by 10 squared. 7 x 10 squared = 7 x 100 = 700

explanations.A: Not quite, I think you divided by 10. There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. Use this to see what you have to multiply or divide by to go from cm cubed to litres.
explanations.B: Not quite, I think you divided by 100. There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. Use this to see what you have to multiply or divide by to go from cm cubed to litres.
explanations.C: There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. To go from cm cubed to litres we divide by 1000 so we get 50 litres.
explanations.D: Not quite, I think you divided by 10000. There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. Use this to see what you have to multiply or divide by to go from cm cubed to litres.

explanations.A: There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. To go from cm cubed to litres we divide by 1000 so we get 30 litres.
explanations.B: Not quite, I think you divided by 10000. There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. Use this to see what you have to multiply or divide by to go from cm cubed to litres.
explanations.C: Not quite, I think you divided by 100. There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. Use this to see what you have to multiply or divide by to go from cm cubed to litres.
explanations.D: Not quite, I think you divided by 10. There are 1000 centimetres cubed in 1 litre. Use this to see what you have to multiply or divide by to go from cm cubed to litres.

explanations.A: This would change g to kg, but we still need to go from kg to tonnes.
explanations.B: Not quite. Use the fact that there are 1000g in a kg and 1000kg in a tonne.
explanations.C: Not quite. Use the fact that there are 1000g in a kg and 1000kg in a tonne.
explanations.D: To go from g to kg we need to divide by 1000, and to go from kg to tonnes we divide by another 1000. This means we are dividing by 1,000,000 which is the same as multiplying by 1/1,000,000

explanations.A: Not quite. Use the fact that there are 1000g in a kg and 1000kg in a tonne.
explanations.B: To go from g to kg we need to divide by 1000, and to go from kg to tonnes we divide by another 1000. This means we are dividing by 1,000,000 which is the same as multiplying by 1/1,000 000. This gives 3 x 1/1,000 000 = 3/1,000 000
explanations.C: Not quite. Use the fact that there are 1000g in a kg and 1000kg in a tonne.
explanations.D: This would change g to kg, but we still need to go from kg to tonnes.
